''Krimschild'' |image=[[Image:Krim Shield.jpg|200px]] |caption=Krim shield with green backing for award to [[German Army (Wehrmacht)|Heer]] soldiers |awarded_by=[[Nazi Germany]] |type=[[Badge]] |eligibility=Military personnel |for=Active service during the [[Crimea]] campaign |campaign=[[World War II]] |status=Obsolete |description= |clasps= |established=25 July 1942 |first_award= |last_award=October 1943 |total=approximately 250,000 |posthumous= |recipients= |individual= |higher= |same= |lower= |related= |image2=[[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 101I-705-0262-06, Ukraine, von Manstein und Speidel.jpg|200px]] |caption2=Correct wearing of the Crimea Shield on the tunic of [[Generalfeldmarschall]] [[Erich von Manstein]] (right). }} The '''Crimea Shield''' ({{Lang-de|Krimschild}}) was a [[World War II]] [[Nazi Germany|German]] military decoration awarded to military personnel under the command of ''Generalfeldmarschall'' [[Erich von Manstein]] who [[Crimean Campaign|fought against Soviet Russian forces]] and captured the [[Crimea]] region (''Krim'' in [[German language|German]]) between 21 September 1941 and 4 July 1942. It was instituted on 25 July 1942.{{sfn|Angolia|1987|p=280}} It was the most widely distributed of the various German shields with approximately 250,000 being awarded. ==Design== The Wehrmacht's [[Army Group South]] advanced through the [[Crimean peninsula]] between the Autumn of 1941 and Summer of 1942. To commemorate the hostilities that ended with the German capture of [[Sevastopol]] on 4 July, 1942 the Crimea Shield was created for all members of the armed forces under area commander Field Marshal [[Erich von Manstein]].{{sfn|Angolia|1987|p=280}} The shield is headed by the German eagle clutching a laurel wreath surrounding a [[swastika]]. Flanking the eagle are the dates '''1941''' and '''1942''', which represent the start and end dates of the campaign. This sits on the backdrop of the Crimean peninsula, where the fighting took place, which has the word '''KRIM''' stamped across it.{{sfn|Angolia|1987|p=280}} ==Criteria for award== The Crimea Shield could be awarded to all members of the Wehrmacht and to Luftwaffe and other units affiliated to the campaign between 21 September 1941 and 4 July 1942. The following conditions needed to have been met for the award:{{sfn|Angolia|1987|p=280}} *Served in the area for at least 90 days; or *Been wounded while serving in the area; or *Had been engaged in a single major engagement ==See also== * [[Cholm Shield]] * [[Demyansk Shield]] * [[Lappland Shield]] * [[Kuban Shield]] * [[Narvik Shield]] == Notes == {{reflist}} == References == *{{cite book | last = Angolia | first = John | title = For FÃ¼hrer and Fatherland: Military Awards of the Third Reich | publisher = R.
